question: Which of the following syndromes represent the syndrome of iron deficiency anemia, glossitis, and dysphagia?

A 39-year-old woman presents with complaints of intermittent attacks of mild diarrhea, fever, and abdominal pain spaced by an asymptomatic period lasting for weeks to months. On physical examination, there are no remarkable findings. GI endoscopy reveals a thick rubbery intestinal wall. In addition, the radiography shows a string sign. Biopsies are performed in this region. Which of the following is the most classical finding of this condition?
Cardiac arrest and small bowel ulcers are the main nutritional toxicity symptoms of which essential macro-mineral?
A patient with a history of arthritis for the last nine years develops hematemesis. What is the most common cause?

A 28-year-old male patient presents to the emergency department with painful swelling 2 cm above the umbilicus. The swelling is well-defined and mushroom-shaped. On examination, cough impulse is negative, the umbilicus is usual in appearance and inverted. A diagnosis of a ventral hernia is made. Which one of the following can not be a hernia content in this patient?
A 45-year-old male with a known case of hepatitis C develops hematemesis. He also has ascites. What is the most common cause?

A 48-year-old female patient is brought to the emergency department with complaints of severe epigastric pain for 1 day, which became generalized and more severe for 3 hours. The pain is associated with vomiting, and she cannot tolerate even a liquid diet. She has a history of NSAID use for osteoarthritis for a long time. Her pulse is 120 beats/min, her blood pressure (BP) is 100/60 mmHg, she is afebrile, and her respiratory rate is 32 breaths/min. She has a tense tender abdomen with board-like rigidity. Gut sounds are inaudible. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

Biopsy of a small and rounded rectal polyp demonstrates glands and saw tooth crypts composed of a proliferation of goblet and columnar epithelial cells. No atypia is seen. This polyp is best classified as which of the following?
Which of the following is the most common benign salivary gland tumor?

A 54-year-old man presents with 5 months of upper abdominal pain accompanied by nausea. He does not have hematemesis. Physical examination is unremarkable, and laboratory workup reveals stool sample positive for occult blood. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy is performed, and gastric biopsies are taken. On microscopic examination, they reveal acute and chronic mucosal inflammation along with the presence of Helicobacter pylori organisms. The presence of these organisms is most likely to be associated with which of the following?
A 50-year-old male develops melena. What could be the probable cause?

A 10-year-old female child weighing 30 kg was brought to you with complaints of fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, passing dark urine, and clay-colored stools for the last 3 days. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 45-year-old man has had vague abdominal pain and nausea for the past 3 years. This pain is unrelieved by antacid medications. He has no difficulty swallowing and no heartburn following meals. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals antral mucosal erythema, but no ulcerations or masses. Biopsies are taken, and microscopically there is chronic non-specific gastritis. Which of the following conditions is most likely to be present in this man?
95% of cancers of the head and neck are:
Which of the following is not safe in patients with celiac disease?
Salt and pepper appearance on microscopy are seen in which tumor?
Which of the following is not a feature of squamous cell carcinoma?

A 41-year-old man has experienced progressive fatigue, pruritus, and jaundice for the past 4 months. He had a total colectomy performed five years ago. On physical examination, he is afebrile and scleral icterus is present. Cholangiography reveals the widespread obliteration of intrahepatic bile ducts. A liver biopsy is performed and microscopic examination shows periductular 'onion skin' fibrosis with a moderate lymphocytic infiltrate. Some intrahepatic bile ducts are obliterated, but there is no interface hepatitis. Which of the following underlying diseases is he most likely to have?

A 38-year-old female patient came to the outpatient department with a complaint of recurrent diarrhea. She is suspected of having Crohn’s disease. A colonoscopy is planned to confirm the diagnosis. Which of the following will be observed in colonoscopy?

A 54-year-old male presented to the emergency with complaints of severe pain in the abdomen, and bilious vomiting. There is a bulge about 8 cm lateral to the umbilicus in the line of linea semilunaris. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old man has had persistent nausea for 5 years with occasional vomiting. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. He undergoes upper gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy, which shows a small area of gastric fundal mucosa has loss of rugal folds. Biopsies are taken and microscopically reveal well-differentiated adenocarcinoma confined to the mucosa. An upper GI endoscopy performed 5 years previously showed a pattern of gastritis and microscopically there was chronic inflammation. Which of the following is the most likely risk factor for his neoplasm?

A 35-year-old lady presented to the outpatient department (OPD) with intermittent diarrhea, fever, and on and off abdominal pain. Biopsy of this patient shows deep ulcers, marked lymphoid reaction, fibrosis, serositis, granuloma mass, and fistulas. Which of the following is the most likely possibility?
Which of the following is a common cause of anemia in small bowel bacterial overgrowth syndrome?

A 45-year-old man was diagnosed with hepatitis B infection 2 years ago. Now he came to the outpatient department (OPD) for the follow-up. Recovery from hepatitis B infection is indicated by which of the following negative test?

Three weeks after a meal at a roadside restaurant, a 20-year-old male presents with loss of appetite, malaise, fatigue, and mild yellowness of sclera. Which of the following laboratory test findings is he most likely to have?

A week-old female baby, weighing 3.5 kg, on breast milk feeding, was brought to the outpatient department (OPD) with complaints of yellow discoloration of skin and sclera for the last one week. The baby is passing dark yellow urine and clay-colored stool. On examination, the baby looks well but the liver is grossly enlarged. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 30-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of shifting pain in the right lower abdomen for 2 days, which has become severe and generalized to the whole abdomen since morning. He is febrile, has three episodes of vomiting, and is unable to take orally. His pulse is 110 b/min, blood pressure (BP) is 100/70 mmHg, temperature is 100F. He has a tense tender abdomen on palpation with absent bowel sounds. What is the most likely cause of his condition?
Healthy carrier state is indicated by positivity for which of the following in HBV infected patients for more than 6 months?
The combination of ethanol and disulfiram results in nausea and hypertension as a result of the accumulation of which of the following?

A 34-year-old man presents in the gastrointestinal (GI) clinic with abdominal pain, and jaundice. His laboratory investigation confirms that he is positive for hepatitis C infection. Which of the following is true of hepatitis C infection?

answers.option: Alpha-interferon is an effective treatment to cure the infection
Persistent infection and chronic hepatitis are the hall marks of the infection
Hepatitis C virus is a DNA virus

question: A 20-year-old man is healthy but has a family history of colon cancer with onset at a young age. There are no abnormal physical examination findings. He undergoes colonoscopy and there are over 200 tubular adenomas ranging in size from 0.2 to 1 cm on gross inspection and microscopic examination of biopsies. Which of the following genetic diseases is he most likely to have?
Treatment for parathyroid hyperplasia is:

A 23-year-old male is brought to the emergency department with the complaint of pain in right lower abdomen for 5 days, which increases after eating. He has off and on diarrhea, with a history of weight loss for 3 months. He is also having intermittent fever for a few weeks. His pulse is 110 b/min, blood pressure (BP) is 100/70 mmHg and temperature is 100F. On examination, there is a tender palpable mass in the right iliac fossa absent bowel sounds. He also has two discharging fistulas in the peri-anal region. A complete blood picture was performed which depicts hemoglobin (Hb) of 8 gm/dl. What is the most likely cause of his condition?
Which of the following infection is associated with nasopharyngeal carcinoma?
Regarding the microscopic picture of pyogenic granuloma, which of the following is true?

answers.option: Shallow hyperemic ulcerations with predominantly mononuclear inflammatory infiltrate
Epithelioid granuloma with multinucleated giant cells
Nodular mass of fibrous tissue with few inflammatory cells
Aggregation of multinucleated giant cells separated by highly vascular stroma
Lobulated masses of capillary sized vessels

question: Which is true regarding achalasia?
What is the most common sign of hepatic obstruction?
Nitrogen is excreted mainly in which form?
APC/beta-catenin pathway is the hallmark of which of the following adenocarcinoma?

A 25-year-old man has noted cramping abdominal pain for the past week. On physical examination, there is right upper quadrant tenderness. Laboratory studies show increased serum transaminases. A liver biopsy was performed, and microscopic examination showed focal necrosis, interface inflammation with the extension of inflammation into the lobules from the portal triad. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 30-year-old man underwent surgery for a road traffic accident, during which the surgeon notices the presence of a submucosal mass in the ileum. On microscopic examination, mass is composed of nests of cells with uniform round nuclei and cytoplasm with small purple granules. Immunohistochemical stain chromogranin is positive in these cells. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
A primigravida woman presents to the clinic with yellow discoloration of the sclera for 15 days. Which of the following is likely the cause of hepatitis in pregnant women?

A 35-year-old man complains of pain in the abdomen for 3 months and nausea for 1 week. His stool sample is positive for occult blood. An upper GI endoscopy reveals normal esophageal mucosa, but a solitary 2 cm diameter shallow, sharply demarcated ulceration of the stomach is seen. Which of the following is most pertinent for this lesion?
What disease shows the salt-and-pepper appearance of chromatin upon biopsy?
Which of the following is true about pleomorphic adenoma?

answers.option: Tumor of myoepithelial cells and chondroid tissue

question: Dysentery is caused by an organism that will also lead to Reiter's syndrome. What is this organism?

A 42-year-old man comes with a history of chronic intake of alcohol. On examination, he has a firm liver that is not enlarged. CT scan reveals a cirrhotic liver. He is then sent to a rehabilitation centre to quit his drinking habit. In spite of complete abstinence from alcohol, he most likely remains at risk of developing which of the following diseases?
What are Mallory bodies?

answers.option: Cytoplasmic inclusions of hepatocytes with keratin

question: Which hepatic neoplasm is associated with oral contraceptive pills (OCPs) consumption?
What is the most common site of a squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus?
Which of the following polyps has the most malignant potential?
What is the histopathological form of squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus?
A blood relative of a patient with FAP (familial adenomatous polyposis) has a biopsy taken from a chronic polyp. Which of the following histological results is most likely?
Which of the following is characterized by recurrent aphthous ulcers?
What is most commonly associated with a tumor in the head of the pancreas?
Which of the following results from the first hit in the pathogenesis of colorectal carcinoma?

answers.option: Germline and somatic mutations of tumor suppressor genes

question: Which of the following is not a complication of acute liver failure?
Which disease does not cause cholestatic jaundice?
What is the most common site of diverticulitis?
A 38-year-old woman presents with weight loss, evening pyrexia, night sweats. On examination, she has a lump in the right quadrant. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most common site of Intestinal tuberculosis?
Which of the following is a polypoid bulge of the mucosa of the large bowel that is present in ulcerative colitis?
Which of the following is characterized by subtotal villous atrophy?
In the adenoma-carcinoma sequence for colorectal carcinomas, what is the second hit in the 'two-hit hypothesis'?
In colorectal cancer which of the following is the first event to occur?
Which morphological change is observed in the villi in celiac disease?
Which of the following sentences describes celiac disease morphology?

answers.option: Crypt hyperplasia, intraepithelial lymphocytosis, and villous atrophy

question: Which of the following groups of cells is responsible for causing celiac disease?
Which one of the following is gastric carcinoid syndrome associated with?
Gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) is associated with a mutation of?
Inflammatory bowel diseases include Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis. Which of the following is the best morphological feature to distinguish between the two diseases?
Which of these is the most common site of involvement in Crohn's disease?

answers.option: Terminal ileum, ileocecal valve and cecum

question: Which of the following tumors share major bulk in the large intestine?
A portocaval anastomosis does not lead to which of the following?
Which of the following is a non-epithelioid gastric tumor?
What is the most common site of colorectal carcinoma?
Which of the following is true regarding gastric carcinoma?

answers.option: Diffuse type has a good prognosis
Intestinal type is associated with H. pylori

question: Which of the following conditions is characterized by profuse, non-bilious vomiting after feeding?
A 38-year-old man presents to the emergency room with abdominal pain. On examination, the abdomen is soft and tender. An abdominal X-ray shows haustrations. Which part of the gut has haustrations?
Ascites resulting from an increase in hydrostatic pressure occurs in which of the following?
A 5-day-old infant presented with diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Which of the following enzyme deficiencies is likely to cause this?
Which of the following nonfunctional plasma enzymes is elevated in alcoholics?
A 2-year-old child with fever for which mother gave her paracetamol every 4 hours. Later he presented with upper quadrant pain and jaundice. Which of the following is the likely cause?

answers.option: Acute liver failure due to paracetamol poisoning

question: A 68-year-old patient presents with abdominal pain, jaundice, and a history of weight loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?

answers.option: Obstruction of the main pancreatic duct
Carcinoma of the head of pancreas
Carcinoma of the tail and body of pancreas

question: A patient is diagnosed with acute pancreatitis. Which of the following laboratory findings will not be seen?

A 31-year-old female presents to the emergency room with abdominal pain and diarrhea alternating with constipation. On stool analysis, a pale, foul-smelling stool is observed. She is advised to start a gluten-free diet. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following risk factors is most strongly associated with the development of fundic gland polyps?
Which of the following imaging techniques is useful in the diagnosis of pancreatic carcinoma?
Mutations of which of the following genes is not associated with the development of hereditary pancreatitis?
Which of the following genes is involved in sporadic colon carcinoma?

Hepatic encephalopathy is a spectrum of disturbances in consciousness, ranging from subtle behavioral abnormalities to marked confusion and stupor, to deep coma and death. Which of the following is a useful indicator of its prognosis?

A 65-year-old male presented to the clinic with a complaint of blood in the vomitus and a history of significant weight loss with ulcer-like symptoms. On upper GI endoscopy, there was a mass in the stomach. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A person presents to the emergency department with chronic diarrhea and abdominal pain for months. Findings show aphthous ulcers, deep linear fissures occupying the ascending and transverse colon but sparing the rectum and descending colon with skipped areas with excess fat creeping over mucosa. Cryptitis is also seen in lamina propria along with non-caseating granulomas. Which is the most probable diagnosis?

A 50-year-old man presents to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain referred to the upper back and left shoulder along with nausea and vomiting. Pain is not relieved by nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). He has a long history of alcohol abuse. The physician is suspecting acute pancreatitis. Which of the following findings is most likely to be present in the patient?

A 35-year-old female patient presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of abdominal discomfort for 3 months that was relieved on defecation. She also gave a history of changes in bowel habits with vitals completely normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
How do we diagnose irritable bowel syndrome?

answers.option: On the basis of clinical criteria

question: Which of the following is not a risk factor for cholangiocarcinoma?
Which of the following colonic polyps is not premalignant?

answers.option: Hamartomatous polyps associated with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome

question: What type of food may cause colon cancer?
Which of the following is the most common clinical presentation of Meckel diverticulum?
Which of the following is the most common site of adenocarcinoma in the small intestine?
Which of the following is the most common tumor of the small intestine?
Which of the following is true about ulcerative colitis with colon cancer?

answers.option: It is related to the duration of ulcerative colitis
Malignancy is more in anorectal ulcerative colitis
It is related to disease activity

question: Gastrointestinal stromal tumors (GISTs) are more commonly found at which of the following locations on the gastrointestinal tract?

While repairing the ileum for a stab wound in a 31-year-old man, a 1 cm circumscribed submucosal mass in the ileum is noticed. Microscopically, the mass is composed of nests of cells with uniform small round nuclei and cytoplasm with small purple granules. The cytoplasm is positive with an antibody to chromogranin. Which of the following pathologic findings is most likely to accompany this man's lesion?

A 20-year-old man is healthy but has a family history of colon cancer with onset at a young age. No abnormal physical examination findings are observed. On colonoscopy, there are over 200 tubular adenomas ranging in size from 0.2 to 1 cm on gross inspection. Which of the following genetic diseases is the man most likely to have?

A 54-year-old alcoholic male presents with sudden onset of severe, constant epigastric pain that radiates to his mid-back. Further evaluation finds fever, steatorrhea, and discoloration around his flank and umbilicus. Lab investigations reveal elevated serum levels of amylase and lipase. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 65-year-old male is operated on for the removal of a pancreatic lesion. The patient's history includes an episode of acute pancreatitis two years prior. The most likely histological feature on microscopic examination is the presence of which of the following?

A 9-year-old child presents with a prolonged history of abdominal discomfort, bloating, constipation, weight loss, and anemia. Serological examination shows positivity for anti-endomysial antibodies. An endoscopic biopsy of the jejunum will most likely show which of the following features?
Which of the following is not a specific feature of dysentery?

answers.option: There is an increase in stool mass

question: A 30-year-old woman presents to the clinic with the complaint of a swollen, red, and painful left knee for the past two weeks. She has a 7-month history of bloody diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain. Abdominal palpation reveals tenderness over the left lower quadrant. Labs show a hemoglobin level of 9.3 g/dL. Microscopic examination of her stool reveals occult blood. A diffusely red, bleeding, friable colonic mucosa is visualized by colonoscopy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female is prescribed a broad-spectrum antibiotic for a severe upper respiratory tract infection. After a few days, the respiratory symptoms improve but the patient now develops abdominal cramps, watery diarrhea, and dehydration. Which of the following organisms is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
Patients suffering from ulcerative colitis are at risk of suffering from which of the following conditions?
Which of the following is the watershed zone?

A 56-year-old female is presented to the hospital with an altered level of consciousness. After evaluation, she is diagnosed with fulminant hepatic failure. History reveals jaundice within the recent past. What is the most likely time duration of encephalopathy to develop in this patient?

A 49-year-old male is admitted to the hospital and is showing signs of impaired neuronal function, rigidity, hyperreflexia, asterixis, and altered level of consciousness. Further history and examination reveal chronic liver disease. Which of the following is the most probable cause of these, manifestations in the patient?
Which of the following types of polyp can be classified as neoplastic?
In Familial Adenomatous Polyposis (FAP), which of the following gene is mutated?
A 60-year-old alcoholic male comes to the medical outpatient department with dilated veins in his abdominal region. He has a history of portal hypertension. What is this condition called?

A 55-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with complaints of difficulty in swallowing and food getting stuck in the esophagus for the past month. He has a history of gastroesophageal reflux disease for five years but isn't compliant with his medication. He is a smoker, and his BMI is 32 kg/m2. He undergoes endoscopy, which reveals intestinal metaplasia in the lower one-third of the esophagus. Which of the following is associated with this condition?

A 60-year-old male patient presented to the outpatient department with complaints of recurrent attacks of right upper quadrant pain, nausea, vomiting, and intolerance for fatty food. His biopsy reports that were done previously showed that the gallbladder wall was variably thickened, and had an opaque gray-white appearance along with buried crypts of epithelium within the gallbladder wall. Outpouchings of the mucosal epithelium through the wall were also visible. Which of the following conditions is closely associated with the above-mentioned symptoms?
Which of the following is the extra-intestinal manifestation of ulcerative colitis?

A 40-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of jaundice, pruritus, and skin xanthomas. The senior doctor says that biopsy reports of the patient show elongated green-brown plugs of bile visible in dilated bile canaliculi. Some canaliculi are ruptured, which causes extravasation of bile, and droplets of bile pigment accumulated within hepatocytes, show a foamy appearance, also called feathery degeneration. Which of the following laboratory investigations can confirm the diagnosis of cholestasis?

answers.option: Elevated serum alkaline phosphatase and γ-glutamyl transpeptidase

question: A man with chronic liver failure due to hepatitis B was brought to the hospital. His imaging reports show regenerative parenchymal nodules with fibrous bands and variable degrees of vascular shunting. Which of the following best describes the mentioned condition?

A 35-year-old female patient reports having epigastric abdominal pain for the last 7 months and has also lost 10 kg weight during this time. She is currently taking proton pump inhibitors (PPI) for her Barrett esophagus. She has recently been experiencing dysphagia and is a heavy smoker with no history of steroids or NSAIDs. What she is at risk of developing?

A 9-year-old child presents with a prolonged history of abdominal discomfort, bloating, constipation, weight loss, and anemia. Serological examination shows positivity for anti-endomysial antibodies. An endoscopic biopsy of the jejunum shows villous atrophy. Which of the following should be avoided?
A patient with chronic liver disease and cirrhosis develops thrombocytopenia due to which of the following reasons mainly?

A 20-year-old woman consults her physician with recurrent abdominal pain, bloating, and discomfort for the last 6 months. She also complains of altered bowel habits, predominantly diarrhea. Her abdominal pain improves after passing stool. There is no history of fever and weight loss. Physical examination is unremarkable. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 52-year-old female presented to the emergency department with jaundice, increased heart rate nausea, sweating, and progressive right upper quadrant pain. She had a history of pale stools and dark-colored urine. Ultrasound showed intracanalicular cholestasis and dilated bile canaliculi but there were no signs of necrosis, fibrosis, or iron deposition. What could be the cause of her clinical picture?

A 50-year-old male presented to the outpatient department with a complaint of right upper quadrant pain along with jaundice, dark urine, and pale stools. Radiographic studies of the gallbladder showed dilated segments alternating with fibrotic areas of intra and extra-hepatic ducts. What would be the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presented to the outpatient department with a history of liver enlargement, pain, hyperbilirubinemia, and ascites. Imaging showed multiple venous thrombi in hepatic veins. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which hormone is associated with increased appetite, especially during fasting and overeating in obese patients?

A child presented to the clinic with complaints of weight loss, chronic diarrhea typically triggered after eating wheat bread, nausea, and itchy rashes/blisters on the extensor surfaces of the body. Which of the following is the clinical diagnosis if the child appears anemic on examination?

A 2-month-old child presented to the outpatient department with the complaint of watery frothy diarrhea and abdominal distention after milk ingestion. The child was exclusively breastfed, and stool volume was less than 200 mg/24 hours. What is the diagnosis?

A child from a consanguineous marriage is brought to the outpatient department with the complaint of pneumonia and other recurrent respiratory tract infections and fatty stools. What could be the most likely diagnosis?

A woman presents to the emergency department with a complaint of severe abdominal pain, and constipation for a few days. She is a mother to 4 children all born via c-section. What could be the cause of her condition?

A 30-year-old female is brought to the emergency room with severe abdominal pain. Two years ago, the woman had a lower gastrointestinal endoscopy, which revealed skip lesions and serpentine ulcers in the colon. Her pulse is 120 beats per minute. X-ray reveals air under the diaphragm. Which of the following conditions is most likely the cause of the current symptoms of the patient?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of malodorous, greasy stools along with right upper quadrant pain. A percutaneous transhepatic cholangiography is done, and the X-ray reveals masses in the gallbladder and cystic duct along with the dilation of bile canaliculi. Which of the following will have the highest elevation in serum when liver function test (LFTs) is done?

A 30-year-old man presented to the outpatient department with complaints of bleeding per rectum for 2 years. On colonoscopy, there was a diffuse inflammation of the rectum and sigmoid colon with superficial mucosal ulcers. A biopsy was performed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old alcoholic is brought to the emergency department with blood-containing vomit. He is given adequate treatment. After a few days, an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy is performed which reveals healed longitudinal tears in the lower third of the esophagus. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's condition?

A 50-year-old female comes to the hospital with complaints of right upper quadrant pain after eating fatty meals. In general appearance, the woman is obese. X-ray shows masses in the gall bladder. The presence of gallstones is confirmed and the woman undergoes laparoscopic cholecystectomy, which reveals jet-black stones that are soft and glassy in appearance. Which of the following is the major composition of the gallstones in this patient?

A 35-year-old woman complained of a month-long, off-and-on burning pain in her upper abdomen, which was moderately intense. She also experienced nausea and had vomited once. There were no signs of black, bloody stools, or vomiting blood. Biopsy results showed she had an H. pylori infection. What are the specific conditions needed to culture H. pylori?

Which microorganism is most likely responsible for the gram-negative bacillary infection found in the histologic evaluation of biopsy specimens from a 49-year-old woman with worsening epigastric pain and a 4-mm duodenal ulcer identified during upper endoscopy, despite no evidence of malignancy?

A hospital admitted a 16-year-old girl who had symptoms such as fever, loss of appetite, feeling sick to her stomach, throwing up, and signs of jaundice like yellowing of the skin and dark urine, as well as pale-colored stool. When her blood was tested, it showed higher levels of certain liver enzymes. Upon further Inquiry, it was discovered that she had recently eaten fast food at a nearby restaurant. Laboratory tests confirmed the presence of IgM HAV antibodies. The virus is transmitted through which of the following?
Which of the following serologic tests is most likely to be positive in patients suffering from chronic diarrhea due to celiac disease?

A 27-year-old man comes to the emergency room with symptoms of acute intestinal obstruction. Examination reveals fever and a mass in the right lower abdominal quadrant. The patient subsequently undergoes surgery, and a segmental lesion involving the terminal ileum is resected showing a thickened wall and loss of mucosal regular folds. Mesenteric adipose tissue seems to creep over bowel loops. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Salmonella typhi and Salmonella paratyphi A and B are bacteria that can cause severe illness by crossing the intestinal lining in humans, ultimately reaching the body's immune system. After an incubation period of 8 to 14 days, they trigger a systemic infection. What is the term used to quantify the level of pathogenicity of the organisms?

A 35-year-old man experienced sudden nausea, vomiting, and extensive diarrhea with watery stools, about 5 liters/day. These symptoms led to dehydration, circulatory collapse, and anuria (lack of urine production) due to the rapid loss of fluids and electrolytes. Which of the following bacterium is the most likely cause?
Which of the following is the most common primary liver cancer?

A middle-aged female has recently gone through Endoscopy due to gastroesophageal reflux disease. Metaplastic change whereby squamous epithelium is replaced by columnar epithelium due to prolonged injury occurs in which of the following?

Upon abdominal examination of a patient, the doctor finds collaterals present as dilated subcutaneous veins extending from the umbilicus toward the rib margins. Sinusoidal dilation that occurs in portal hypertension is known as?
Which of the following leads to anemia in gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)?
A pregnant woman in her second trimester had painless bleeding per rectum without any history of constipation or diarrhea. What could be the possible reason for the bleeding?
What is the appearance of Mallory Denk bodies?

A 65-year-old male presented to the OPD with a complaint of dysphagia, weight loss, and fatigue. Initially, there was difficulty in eating solids which then progressed to complete avoidance of solid food. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient with a history of alcohol abuse now has grade 3 fibrosis in the liver. Which of the following histopathological features will be observed in this patient?

A 45-year-old male is a known case of hepatitis C. He presents to the clinic with ascites, and jaundice for 2 weeks. He has a history of similar episodes in the past. Which of the following correctly correlates with his condition?
Which of the following classifies as osmotic diarrhea?
Which of the following hormones is most likely decreased in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD)?
What is the primary mechanism by which lactase deficiency causes diarrhea?
Which brush border enzyme is responsible for breaking down 1-6 glycosidic linkages in carbohydrates?
Which organism is most commonly associated with enterocolitis in infants?
Which cells are responsible for fibrosis?
In steatosis, what percentage of hepatocyte damage is typically observed?
What are Mallory-Denk bodies composed of?
Which type of lipoprotein is commonly referred to as "good fat"?
A patient presents with a midline swelling in the neck. Deficiency of which mineral is most likely responsible for this condition?
A child presents with diarrhea, stunted growth, abdominal bloating, weight loss, irritability, and fatigue. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In which type of hemolytic jaundice are dark stools observed?
In triple therapy for Helicobacter pylori infection, which drug can be replaced with amoxicillin?
In triple therapy for H. pylori infection, which drug is given in combination with amoxicillin and omeprazole?

A patient with a history of tuberculosis (TB) one year ago presents with a tense and tender abdomen. Imaging reveals free air under the diaphragm. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

A mother visits a primary health care center with her 2-year-old child and complains that the child does not eat well and is lethargic. On examination, the child has sparse, easily pluckable golden-brown hair, puffy eyes, edema, thin limbs, a protruded belly, along with a skin rash. The child is most likely a case of
A patient presented to the outpatient department with reports that were positive for viral hepatitis. What type of jaundice can be seen?
What hepatitis B marker is used to determine the active phase of infection when hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) is absent?

A 41-year-old woman has had diarrhea and fatigue with 3 kg weight loss over the past 6 months. On examination, she is afebrile with mild muscle wasting, but her motor strength is normal. Lab studies show no occult blood, ova, or parasites in stool. The patient begins following a special diet with no wheat or rye grain products. Symptoms improve on the non-gluten diet. What is the most likely microscopic feature seen in the biopsy specimen?

A 50-year-old man presents to the hospital with something coming out of his rectum when defecating. There are blood streaks along with the fecal matter, and he is able to push it back inside. What is the grading of the hemorrhoid?
What is a major risk factor for colon cancer?
Which group is most at risk for developing ischemic bowel disease?
A patient had gallstones that were black with sharp edges. What type of stones were these?

A 50-year-old male presents with RUQ pain that worsens after eating, accompanied by fever and jaundice. He has a history of biliary stones and recent weight loss. On examination, he is febrile with tenderness in the RUQ. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old female presents with abdominal pain and bloody stools. On biopsy of the bowel wall, non-caseating granulomas are observed. She has a history of intermittent diarrhea and weight loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following hormones plays a key role in regulating the body’s iron levels?
Which of the following antibodies are most commonly associated with celiac disease?

A 50-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of fatigue, intermittent hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus (diagnosed 5 years ago), and right upper quadrant discomfort for the past six months. He also has a history of hyperlipidemia and drinks alcohol socially but denies heavy alcohol use. His BMI is 31. On physical examination, there is no ascites. Lab results show AST 58 U/L (normal <40), ALT 90 U/L (normal <40), fasting glucose of 145 mg/dL, HbA1c 8.5%, and total cholesterol 245 mg/dL. Hepatitis B and C serologies are negative. An ultrasound of the abdomen shows an enlarged liver with increased echogenicity, consistent with fatty liver. Which of the following is the most important risk factor contributing to the development of this patient's liver condition?

A 47-year-old woman presents to the clinic with fatigue and dull, persistent discomfort in the right upper quadrant for the past three months. She is overweight (BMI: 31 kg/m²) and has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus, diagnosed three years ago, with poor blood sugar control despite oral hypoglycemic therapy. She denies any significant alcohol use. On physical examination, there is mild hepatomegaly without tenderness. Laboratory results show ALT: 80 U/L, AST: 70 U/L, HbA1c: 8.4%, and triglycerides of 240 mg/dL. Hepatitis B and C serologies are negative. Abdominal ultrasound reveals an enlarged liver with increased echogenicity, suggestive of fatty infiltration. Which of the following is the most important risk factor contributing to the development of this patient's liver condition?

answers.option: Excessive iron deposition in the liver
Direct viral infection of liver cells causing inflammation
Increased hepatic fat accumulation due to insulin resistance
Alcohol-induced oxidative stress on liver cells
